intro: Cussonia paniculata var. sinuata, commonly known as the Sinuata arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, arrowhead-shaped leaves that are often deeply lobed and have a distinctive sinuous margin, giving it its varietal name. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are borne on branched inflorescences. It is a member of the Marantaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The Sinuata arrowroot is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been used in traditional medicine.
